content:
Diagnosis:
T2N1M0 adenocarcinoma of distal esophagus, HER2 positive (3+)

Investigations:
Endoscopy and biopsy 15 March 2024 - Distal esophageal mass at 35-38cm
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis 20 March 2024 - T2 primary tumor with regional lymphadenopathy
PET-CT 25 March 2024 - FDG-avid primary and regional nodes, no distant metastases

Previous medical history:
Type 2 diabetes
Hypertension
GERD

Current medications:
Metformin 1g BD
Ramipril 5mg OD
Omeprazole 20mg BD

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Newly diagnosed esophageal cancer
ECOG Performance Status 1
Weight loss 5kg over 3 months
Mild dysphagia to solids only

I reviewed [redacted name] today to discuss treatment options following completion of staging investigations. The diagnosis is a HER2 positive adenocarcinoma of the distal esophagus, stage T2N1M0. He describes mild dysphagia to solids only, with some improvement since starting omeprazole. His weight has stabilized over the past month.

On examination, he is well-appearing with normal cardiorespiratory examination. Blood results show stable renal function and normal liver function tests.

I have discussed the role of perioperative chemotherapy with the addition of trastuzumab given the HER2 positive status. The plan is for 3 cycles of FLOT chemotherapy with trastuzumab, followed by restaging and surgery, then 3 further cycles post-operatively. I have arranged for PICC line insertion next week and chemotherapy to start the following week. He will be reviewed prior to each cycle.
